column5: [QUOTE=prov1800;6587716]Good to hear that the area has gotten some rain. It sure was needed. The water bomber flyboys and ground crews have sure earned their pay this summer. Much respect for those folks. PjShorthorn
[QUOTE=pjshorthorn;6587726]That's for sure
Can use any kind of help.Smoky a bit today but has blown out mostly

RE: Gullet - I normally can get 2 pieces out of one by cutting lengthwise, and attaching to a bucktail/feathered jig. Piece not used can be wrapped in a wet cloth; the front part of the gullet is super tough, sometime can get much of a day out of the same piece, even when catching! Long time ago, I watched a pike pick up such a jig just sitting on the bottom in shallow water, assumed attraction was scent. Bill
Iam sure its the scent Bill.They definatly last unless a northern bites it off or get hung up on a rock.But they are easy to replace.
John make sure next week to look both ways pulling out of the driveway,the Indy 500 is about to start

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6586570]John make sure next week to look both ways pulling out of the driveway,the Indy 500 is about to start[IMG Can't wait.lol.Will see how busy it gets.Camps are not booked 100%.Dont think even 50%Theres openings all over and some wont be open at all
[QUOTE=prov1800;6586590]Plenty people do not like fall fishing,some don't want the hassle to get in,and I'm sure there are other reasons.I'm all in for 2 trips.

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6586596]All true.Ive talked to lots of groups and lots have had trips elsewhere already.Aug/Sept are great months for fishing.Ive got a number of trips but nothing close to normal.Sept better for me.At least all the hunters will be up.So looking forward to that.

[QUOTE=prov1800;6586600]All your guest will be very excited to see you and to spend time on the water with you,it would be nice if you got pounded by heavy rain there for a few days and it stopped by sept 11.lol
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6586602]Definatly a few days of rain would be welcomed.Havnt used my frogg toggs yet since spring.And that was to keep wind out.

[QUOTE=prov1800;6586606]So it rained on Teus/Wed and rained good enough to get everything moist and hooefully help out with the fires.Wife and I decided to go to Cedar yesterday instead of Lac Suel as it was a cool windy day.We headed for east end from Clarks and that was a cool experience.We both got a little more dressed up for that trip.First time in months I wore pants and a jacket.First fish I caught was a crappie.Great day of fishing but the east wind and cold front slowed it down a bit.Saw lots of schools of fish on our spots and some bit but not like crazy.Around noon though the bite really picked up real good.Water temp went down to around 65 f from 75f+ in 2 days.On our way back to west side we stopped and muskie fished a few spots and had 5 to the boat not in the net.2 real good big girls.Few pike but not as many as we get most days.Few good days coming and then more rain.Still have smoke daily but some days not bad and some bad.
It would nice,but I would not bet on it.
Me neither.But you never know.
Never tire of the pics and quips! Thanks for sharing and keep em coming. Won't be long and you'll be sharing paradise.
Yup.looking forward to it in a way.Its been pretty awesome having all that water to ourselves.Hard to describe.But back to business

Solo trip today. Late start.Turned out to be super hot at 31c and no wind.Very smoky today.Getting tired of the smoke.Saw 4 muskies early then nothing. Tried a while longer and only caught some pike which were slow to.On to the walleyes.Very good bite but mainly small one again but ended up with 4 good eatèrs.Smallies are in about the same depth as walleyes so ended up catching a bunch of them to.Fun day except for the smoke
John you need a fireman's air pac,your sucking in a lot of second hand smoke,you might look like an alien fishing with a air pac on,but least you can breath.
Oh I forgot to thank you for the pics,I haven't seen you in a picture for 24 hours,almost forgot what you look like.lol
That smoke looks bad I can see why you would be tired of it.
Daily depending on wind.this morning I had ash all over mý truck.Kinda hoping for a snow storm right now.lol.no rain for ever.
Don't wry the Americans will bring some storms up.
Iam sure he enjoyed it till he saw me.lol.Got spooked but I left it alone.
I got alittle spooked also when I saw you john,bit I got over it quickly
Funny

Pretty decent day seeing muskies but only got one small one in the boat.Fished walleyes about a hour and they came fast but also mostly small but good eating size since iam not to fussy.Beautifull day.Not to hot and no smoke for a change.never left Clarks bay.Only took 3 doz minnows and they were gone pretty fast.Couple of pics for Rod with gullet I took out today.
Thanks john even looks good for me to eat.I got the hang of it now.
That piece is kinda chewy.lol.

That fish took it on the chinand I'm sure the rest of the fish may already be consumed as I'm typing this.won't be long john and the eagles n seagulls will be putting on some winter fat also,probably there feast will start around aug 10.
You know it Rod.From livewell to the plate.BBQ walleye tonight and fresh garden beans picked from the garden.Eagles looking thin.
Dam,you don't need a grocery store your surrounded by one.Every pic your getting everyone more fired up,boot camps over time to do battle.
Hope the border deal is smooth for everyone.
[QUOTE=prov1800;6584672]Good ole camp robinson rd,lots of float planes n minnows lol
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6584682]The road to adventure.lol.Lots of minnows and lots of planes.Busy place lots of planes taking off.
[QUOTE=prov1800;6584696]That's your Canadian Disney world,and for us to vacation there,don't get any better than that,I hope 2 flats of crawlers is enough for me for a week?
That's a nice walleye John!
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6584726]You can always take a flashlight out at night and look for crawlers, of course mama bear might have a problem with you wondering around in her territory!

Pretty decent.Hit a spot were they were either 10" or 20" plus.only fished half hr for them.Got to really look for them.Not on humps yet.There hanging out in weird spots in 15' and not really biting very good.I see them but tgat doesnt mean much.lol.tried all kinds of ways.Will get some but slow.Probably better early or later maybe.Iam to lazy to try early.lol.Pike and muskies keeping me busy right now.That bite is on.
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6584726]I have no idea how many worms are in a flat.never use worms

[QUOTE=prov1800;6584748]When ever I have been at a outpost with clarks I never have to worry about bait.But have run out many times on the water and have used a walleye gullet which is legal and lethal.Just remember to take it off at end of day or you'll be fighting with the next to get it off.
Didn't post this I don't think but had yogi bear visit me the other day to.
LOL! Looks like the bear is enjoying a nice cool swim.

Great day on Cedar.Muskies were nuts today.Had around 20 to the boat today and put 5 in the net.One decent one and saw huge in the 50" range but coukdnt get her.Bluebird skies and no wind. Couldn't beleive the action.Fished walleyes for about 5 min and got a fast limit for supper before I packed up and headed back to Clarks.Saw 4 water bombers flying by coming from one of 150 fires here.My quite days are slowly coming to a end.Hope you guys get across the border without to much trouble.
What a day john,great weather and action up the kazoooooo.
Hard to beat.Got rain in forecast.Hoping it rains.
Go outside and do a rain dance!
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6583924]Go outside and do a rain dance![/QUOTEHave tried it

[QUOTE=prov1800;6583928]Another awesome day on Cedar.Put 5 skis in the boat again.Saw a few more and most a couple. Walleyes were slow but did good still.Quite day as usuall on the water.Wont bother with pics as tgere all the same.Just put one up of a black bear I saw swimming across the lake.Didnt want to scare it so took a pic and left it alone.
[QUOTE=prov1800;6584618]The bears probably can smell all's those nice minnows in your boat.
[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6584648]If the bear smelled anything it was all the pike and muskie slime in my boat.lol.minnows were in my live Well.Only walleye fished maybe half hour.
[QUOTE=prov1800;6584654]If you could only get some good rain for the fires and also to wash your slimy boat.haha

[QUOTE=Eckohlt;6584664]Actually did rain this morning but not much.Supposed to rain some throughout the day but also thunder storms.Its a real cool day so far and fairly windy.going to do oil change on boat today,new plugs and fuel filter and change out my fuel line to.Check lower unit out.Just get ready for what ever happens.Going to get fairly busy but not nuts I don't think.
